channel.title: Compiler help
channel.description: what do i do when it says cannot find the correct path specifide

item.title: Compiler help
item.dc:creator: @skatersscape skatersscape
item.description:
@skatersscape wrote:

Here is my compiler code, it finds the path to jdk automatically:

@echo off if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler help
item.dc:creator: @n00bf0rlyf3 n00bf0rlyf3
item.description:
@n00bf0rlyf3 wrote:

Alright man I had the same problem until usman555 helped me… What you want to do is downloaded jdk 21 package in the downloads and then set your variables and use this compiler that works for me

@echo off
Title Compiler
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin\javac.exe” *.java
pause

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler help
item.dc:creator: @nardoscape nardoscape
item.description:
@nardoscape wrote:

right click -> edit -> change the JDK type in there to the one you have.

jdk1.6.0_17 is what it says in my compiler, thats because thats the kind i have. you can find your jdk type c:/ -> program files (x86) -> java -> jdk -> jdk1.6.0_(your jdk type)

Read full topic
